reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nFor the first day on Early Access, the game is surprisingly well playable. The performance is good and I did not notice any major bugs so far. Of course there is still a lot to do for the developers, but you can get an impression of what the final game will be like. Currently you can play the on randomly generated maps in the endless descend" mode
date: a campaign mode is scheduled to be released during EA. There is already a variety of traps and hazardous objects that make it quite difficult to get you team out alive. So
recommended: if you like the challenge of a tactical/strategical exploration game and can put up with the fact that campaign
voteText: etc. are still in the making
helpfulPercent: this game is just right for you

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This is an Earl Access review of this game.

Full disclosure: Im helping these guys out in some of their beta testing and have played some of the version before this EA build.

In general the Game has a very interesting premise and shows a lot of potential. It can be a very fun and engaging already.

Its a hard game and if you like a challenge this may be the game for you.

The game Focusses more on managment of your ressources than on Combat and is in itself a very unique and innovative gameplay.
naturally since it is still in early Access its still very rough around the Edges but the general gameplay is already implemented and quite extensive.

in the end it will depend on the further development but i can certainly recommend giving this a try if you are ready to engage yourself in a beta version of a game.

The developers definitely show a lot of respect for Feedback and ideas and are engaging with any input coming their way.
voteText: 11 of 20 people (55%) found this review helpful

Early Access Review

Great game with a fresh perspective on strategy and an intuitive but completely novel menu and character set. You like mold-breaking games that have been developed with a lot of love, then this is the game for you.

Early Access Review

I actually relly enjoy this game. It's a fun little game that I get to see growing each and every month and keeps me interested in the next update.

I'm looking to the full release of the game and will continue playing every month with the new updates.
